meanings.definition: Used as an intensifier to express anger or frustration.
meanings.sent1: She was bleeping mad when her ice cream fell on the floor.
meanings.sent2: I am so bleeping tired after running for an hour.
meanings.sent3: He looked bleeping annoyed when his computer crashed during the presentation.
meanings.sent4: The bleeping rain ruined our picnic plans.
meanings.sent5: The bleeping noise from the construction site kept me up all night.

meanings.definition: Used as a euphemism for a swear word.
meanings.sent1: She let out a loud bleeping after hitting her thumb with the hammer.
meanings.sent2: He muttered a bleeping under his breath when he missed the bus.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's bleeping got the audience laughing at the family-friendly show.
meanings.sent4: The toddler's innocent bleeping made everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The teacher overheard a student's bleeping in the hallway.

meanings.definition: The act of censoring or replacing offensive language with a beep sound.
meanings.sent1: The TV show used bleeping to cover up the inappropriate language.
meanings.sent2: During the live broadcast, they had to do some quick bleeping.
meanings.sent3: The bleeping in the movie made the scene even funnier.
meanings.sent4: The radio station had to add bleeping to comply with regulations.
meanings.sent5: The comedian's bleeping added a comedic touch to the performance.
